about features architecture

Sunnova Catalyst

About features Architecture

Sunnova's main service offering is financing for solar panel systems for residential homes; and they use mobile apps to help accomplish this-- which is where my software development skillsets come in. The app I helped build in 2023 (with a team of ~15 people) is called 'Sunnova Catalyst' on the app stores. Catalyst is a business-to-franchise app for Sunnova authorized solar panel dealerships to use with residential solar panel installation. After dealers install this equipment they submit photos of the installed equipment to Sunnova, and then Sunnova sends them a commissioning check. They also have a consumer facing app that Sunnova-customers can use to monitor/customize their residential home energy systems.

The purpose of this website is to display what I built while at Sunnova because it was an innovative businesses and I enjoyed my time,... However, my time at Sunnova came to an end, and I am now targeting opportunities in the DACH region of Europe or remote roles in the USA. I am primarily interested in software development projects building go-to-market/business/government apps utilizing any of the following languages> JavaScript, TypeScript, Ruby, Python, Swift, Kotlin, or Rust.

Customers

As of 2023 Sunnova had 348k+ Customers, and there are approximately ~500 systems installed daily through the Sunnova dealership network.

Customers

Locations

Sunnova operates in 47 US States and Territories. They have a large presence in Puerto Rico already (assisted rebuilding eletrical grid infrastructure after hurricane Maria in 2017), and they're attempting to expand into the German market. They also have remote employees all over the globe.

Locations

Founding

John Berger started Sunnova in Houston in 2012 and a lot of the senior staff are from the traditional Houston oil and gas industry, banking peoples, and so many former consultants. I am very grateful for the time I was able to spend learning from these folks.

Founding

IPO

Sunnova IPO'd in 2019 with Bank of America, J.P. Morgan, Goldman Sachs, and Credit Suisse as the underwriters (14,000,000 shares of its common stock at $12.00 per share = $16.8 million market capitalization).

Initial Public Offering

Dealerships

There are 1.3k dealerships in Sunnova's network that the Catalyst app was built to support.

Dealerships

App History

The Sunnova consumer facing app was launched in 2023. The Sunnova Catalyst app has been designed twice now-- the first time with Xamarin for mobile apps and Ionic for web apps, and the most recent mobile and web apps were built in one typescript codebase for react native and react for web.

App History

Salesforce

Salesforce

Salesforce used Sunnova as a case study in their Dreamforce 2023 conference, and I was told that Sunnova had the largest salesforce instance in the southern US. I worked on the development of the Mulesoft data flows mentioned in this video below that enable Sunnova to make quotes in 15 minutes on customers who want solar equipment installed on their home.

Microgrids

Microgrids

are extremely important to Sunnova's current strategy. A solar panel microgrid is a localized energy system that uses solar panels to generate electricity, incorporates batteries for storage, and distributes power within a specific area.

D.o.E

Department of Energy

In 2023 the Department of Energy approved $3 billion worth of financing as backstop for Sunnova for customers that stop paying for their solar systems. The goal with this financing is to provide lower income areas in the US access to solar power, and the funding is a part of "project Hestia".

The codebase for Catalyst supports an ios and android app for solar-dealerships to submit (solar installation) 'site-survey's' and 'commissioning packages' to Sunnova for review so that the solar-dealerships can get a commissioning-payout from Sunnova. There also is a web app for Sunnova-corporate-staff/engineers to review site-survey's + commissioning packages and approve/reject them. All these apps use Salesforce to store data and communicate with each other. The main purpose of all these embedded apps inside/connecting other apps is to help dealerships (with Sunnova as the Franchise owner) sell + install solar panel systems and accessories.

Site Survey

Before Sunnova can quote a customer with how much installing solar equipment on their property will cost they need to figure out some specifications of the property. ie; roof pitch, attic + roof rafter specs, subpanel + main breaker, what electrical utility company they are using, etc, etc. This portion of thier app is called "site survey", and it is a survey that dealers fill out, and then the data is saved in postgres Sql tables. Then the data from these SQL tables is ported over to Salesforce via Mulesoft. Below are some screenshots from this survey. the survey-prompt-types supported are> photo, number, long-text, multiple selection, boolean, and some questions can be marked as "does not apply". Below are some example screens from the site-survey portion of the app.

Commissioning Package

After a customers property has been inspected, and they want to move forward with the solar installation process dealers will install the equipment to Sunnova's specifications, and then use the second feature of the Catalyst mobile app -- which is for submitting commissioning packages to Sunnova. The gallery below displays the core process of submitting a commissioning package (CP) through the Catalyst app.
